Authors:
Marek Halama, Gro Gulden, Tor Erik Brandrud, Egil
Bendiksen, Ryszard Rutkowski, Jacek Urbaniak, Matylda
Czosnykowska-Łukacka, Tadeusz Dobosz
Title:
A new species of a rare genus Squamanita (Basidiomycota:
Squamanitaceae) from the Western Carpathians of Poland
Keywords:
fungicolous fungi, mycoparasites, conidial forming agaric,
ITS, molecular phylogeny, taxonomy
Abstract:
Squamanita pseudofimbriata sp. nov., discovered on the
north-eastern slope of Mt Babia Góra, southern Poland, is described and
illustrated as a new species to science based on both morphological and
molecular data. This mycoparasite was found in June growing on
basidiomata of Kuehneromyces lignicola. It was fruiting on wooden
remnants in a mixed montane Picea-Abies forest. The new agaric closely
resembles Squamanita fimbriata macroscopically, but it differs
microscopically chiefly in the smaller basidiospores, basidia and
chlamydospores, and somewhat shorter cheilocystidia. Phylogenetic
analysis based on nuclear ribosomal ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 sequences showed that
the new species forms an independent well-supported branch
